BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: New snow and wet snow represent the main danger. Moist and wet avalanches are still to be expected.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The southerly wind has transported some snow.
In particular on wind-loaded slopes the avalanches can be triggered in the new snow and wind slab layers and reach medium size. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation this applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.
The fresh snow and the wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant.
As a consequence of the rain wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Ski touring and other off-piste activities, including snowshoe hiking, call for caution.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 20 to 30 cm of snow, but less in some localities, has fallen since Friday above approximately 2200 m. The southerly wind has transported the new snow.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
The surface of the snowpack cooled hardly at all during the overcast night and will already be soft in the early morning. Precipitation at intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: On Wednesday as the precipitation becomes more intense there will be a gradual increase in the danger.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of high temperatures and rain up to intermediate altitudes the snowpack can not consolidate.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls wind slabs formed.
The fresh snow and the wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant.
As a consequence of the precipitation more avalanches are possible as the day progresses, even large ones in isolated cases.
As the moisture increases moist and wet avalanches are to be expected. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Ski touring and other off-piste activities, including snowshoe hiking, call for caution.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Friday above approximately 2000 m. The southerly wind has transported the new snow.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
Above approximately 2200 m a lot of snow is lying.
The surface of the snowpack will cool hardly at all during the overcast night.
Precipitation to intermediate altitudes: The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: On Wednesday as the precipitation becomes more intense there will be a gradual increase in the danger.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Moist snow slides and avalanches are the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As the moisture increases moist loose snow avalanches are possible, in particular at low and intermediate altitudes, especially on very steep slopes, and at the base of rock walls.

Sunday: The strong wind has transported the new snow, in particular along the border with Switzerland. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions mostly small wind slabs formed.

During the day: Increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as the precipitation becomes more intense.

The moist fresh snow and the wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. Ski touring and other off-piste activities, including snowshoe hiking, call for caution.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Over a wide area 10 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2100 m. The southerly wind has transported the new snow.
The new snow of the weekend is poorly bonded. This snow as well as the wind slabs remain in some cases prone to triggering. The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong melt-freeze crust.
The high temperatures gave rise to moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow. Below approximately 2000 m hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: In some regions increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Moist snow slides and avalanches are the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As the moisture increases moist loose snow avalanches are possible, in particular at low and intermediate altitudes, especially on very steep slopes, and at the base of rock walls.

Sunday: The strong wind has transported the new snow, in particular along the border with Switzerland. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions mostly small wind slabs formed.

During the day: Increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as the precipitation becomes more intense.

The moist fresh snow and the wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. Ski touring and other off-piste activities, including snowshoe hiking, call for caution.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Over a wide area 10 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2100 m. The southerly wind has transported the new snow.
The new snow of the weekend is poorly bonded. This snow as well as the wind slabs remain in some cases prone to triggering. The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong melt-freeze crust.
The high temperatures gave rise to moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow. Below approximately 2000 m hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: In some regions increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as a consequence of new snow and wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: From the early morning as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches to level 3 (considerable). Backcountry tours should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In all aspects wet loose snow avalanches are possible. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Gliding avalanches can also occur. In particular in the regions with a lot of snow large and, in isolated cases, very large avalanches are possible.
Avalanches can be released by a single winter sport participant.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions will give rise to moistening of the snowpack.
Wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. This applies in particular on shady slopes.
Weak layers exist in the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: From the early morning as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches to level 3 (considerable). Backcountry tours should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In all aspects wet loose snow avalanches are possible. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Gliding avalanches can also occur. In particular in the regions with a lot of snow large and, in isolated cases, very large avalanches are possible.
Avalanches can be released by a single winter sport participant.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions will give rise to moistening of the snowpack.
Wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. This applies in particular on shady slopes.
Weak layers exist in the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: From the early morning as a consequence of solar radiation there will be an increase in the danger of moist avalanches. Weakly bonded old snow requires caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Small and medium-sized natural avalanches are possible in all aspects. Adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent. Wind slabs can in some places be released by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size. Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The weather conditions will foster a weakening of the near-surface layers from the early morning.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of wet avalanches in the course of the day. Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering in high Alpine regions.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Early and late morning:
The more recent wind slabs are now only very rarely prone to triggering. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep shady slopes in high Alpine regions.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

During the day:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase gradually. More frequent small to medium-sized wet loose snow avalanches are possible below approximately 2800 m, this also applies on extremely steep sunny slopes in high Alpine regions.
In very isolated cases avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach a dangerous size.

In addition further individual gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started early and concluded timely.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day. The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing softening of the snowpack in all aspects below approximately 2800 m, this also applies on sunny slopes in high Alpine regions.

As a consequence of a strong wind from southerly directions, wind slabs formed in the last few days in high Alpine regions. The weather effects brought about a substantial stabilisation of the snow drift accumulations.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of wet avalanches in the course of the day. Wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering in high Alpine regions.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Early and late morning:
The more recent wind slabs are now only very rarely prone to triggering. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep shady slopes in high Alpine regions.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

During the day:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase gradually. More frequent small to medium-sized wet loose snow avalanches are possible below approximately 2800 m, this also applies on extremely steep sunny slopes in high Alpine regions.
In very isolated cases avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach a dangerous size.

In addition further individual gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started early and concluded timely.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften during the day. The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing softening of the snowpack in all aspects below approximately 2800 m, this also applies on sunny slopes in high Alpine regions.

As a consequence of a strong wind from southerly directions, wind slabs formed in the last few days in high Alpine regions. The weather effects brought about a substantial stabilisation of the snow drift accumulations.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of wet avalanches in the course of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually, this also applies on shady slopes. Mostly these are small.

In addition further gliding avalanches are possible, in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes.
The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing softening of the snowpack also on shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Caution is to be exercised in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m.
At low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Some snow will fall in some regions. The danger of dry and wet avalanches will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of wet avalanches in the course of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually, this also applies on shady slopes. Mostly these are small.

In addition further gliding avalanches are possible, in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes.
The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing softening of the snowpack also on shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Caution is to be exercised in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m.
At low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Some snow will fall in some regions. The danger of dry and wet avalanches will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The early morning will see favourable conditions over a wide area, but the danger of wet avalanches will increase later.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet loose snow avalanches being released will increase quickly, in particular on extremely steep slopes below approximately 2800 m, as well as on sunny slopes in all altitude zones.
Small and medium-sized wet loose snow avalanches are possible. In very isolated cases avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach a dangerous size.

In addition further small to medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started early and concluded timely.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust only at high altitudes and will already soften in the late morning. This applies in particular on sunny slopes. The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack also on shady slopes below approximately 2800 m.

Below approximately 2000 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The early morning will see favourable conditions over a wide area, but the danger of wet avalanches will increase later.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet loose snow avalanches being released will increase quickly, in particular on extremely steep slopes below approximately 2800 m, as well as on sunny slopes in all altitude zones.
Small and medium-sized wet loose snow avalanches are possible. In very isolated cases avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach a dangerous size.

In addition further small to medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

Backcountry tours, off-piste skiing and ascents to alpine cabins should be started early and concluded timely.

The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack also on shady slopes below approximately 2800 m.

Below approximately 2000 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of wet avalanches in the course of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually especially on extremely steep sunny slopes. Mostly these are small. This also applies in isolated cases on shady slopes below approximately 2800 m.

In addition further gliding avalanches are possible, in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes.
The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing softening of the snowpack also on shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Caution is to be exercised in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Some snow will fall in some regions. The danger of dry and wet avalanches will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of wet avalanches in the course of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually especially on extremely steep sunny slopes. Mostly these are small. This also applies in isolated cases on shady slopes below approximately 2800 m.

In addition further gliding avalanches are possible, in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes.
The high temperatures as the day progresses will give rise to increasing softening of the snowpack also on shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Caution is to be exercised in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Some snow will fall in some regions. The danger of dry and wet avalanches will increase during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The danger of wet avalanches will increase a little during the day. Especially on rocky slopes mostly small wet avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will soften quickly. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack also on shady slopes at elevated altitudes.

At low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of wet avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet snow represents the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming individual moist and wet avalanches are possible from the late morning, but they will be mostly small. The avalanches can occur naturally as well. The avalanche prone locations are to be found especially in extremely steep terrain at high altitude and in steep rocky terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: At intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying. At high altitude only a little snow is lying. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. The solar radiation will give rise from early morning to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack. The meteorological conditions will bring about a weakening of the snowpack in particular in steep terrain that is interspersed with rocks.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of wet avalanches in the course of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase gradually, this also applies on shady slopes. Mostly these are small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust and will soften quickly. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing softening of the snowpack also on shady slopes at elevated altitudes.

At low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Above approximately 1800 m snow will fall in some regions. The danger of moist and wet snow slides will increase but remain within the current danger level.
